docs.title: Honey Tree Guide
docs.text:
REQUIRED

[3] Honey to start with + [HM Fly], [HM Cut], [HM Rock Smash] and [HM Surf]

RECOMMENDED

Honey Gather Pokémon: Combee or Teddiursa [HA], [HM Defog], [Repel]

INTRODUCTION Honey Tree Shiny Hunting Guide

This guide will teach you how to efficiently shiny hunt Honey Trees, which are exclusive to the Sinnoh region.

The route begins in Canalave City and ends near Sunyshore City.

There are 21 Honey Trees in total; however, we recommend skipping the one on Route 221 (near Pal Park), as it’s typically not worth the travel time.

Two Main Methods
  1. Run + Slather – quickly reapplying honey and moving on.
  2. Battle the Pokémon – lead with a Pokémon that knows Honey Gather, or a combo of Frisk + Thief.
Team Shiny Legion [MANY]

By using this guide, you’re assumed to be a member of Team Shiny Legion [MANY].

Need help? Message Kelly or Kole in-game, in the club, or on Discord.

Not a member yet? Mail or whisper Kelly to join or learn more.

Timing
  • Trees take 1 hour to attract Pokémon after applying honey.
Held Items by Pokémon
  • Munchlax
    • Leftovers
  • Combee
    • Honey
  • Cherubi
    • Miracle Seed
  • Wurmple
    • Pecha Berry
    • Bright Powder
Available Pokémon
  • Common
    • Combee
    • Wurmple
  • Uncommon
    • Aipom
    • Burmy
    • Cherubi
  • Rare
    • Cascoon
    • Silcoon
  • Very Rare
    • Heracross
    • Munchlax
HONEY TREE LOCATIONS 🍯 Honey Tree 1

Canalave City → Route 218

  • Fly to Canalave City
  • Go South, then East into Route 218 Gate
  • Find the Honey Tree near the water
🍯 Honey Tree 2

Floaroma Town → Floaroma Meadow

  • Fly to Floaroma Town
  • Go West, then North into Floaroma Meadow
  • Talk to NPC, you need a total of [60] Honey
  • Find the Honey Tree east of the NPC
🍯 Honey Tree 3

Floaroma Town → Route 205 → Valley Windworks

  • Fly back to Floaroma Town
  • Go East into Route 205
  • Continue East into Valley Windworks
  • Find the Honey Tree on the East side of Valley Windworks
🍯 Honey Tree 4

Valley Windworks → Route 205

  • Go back West into Route 205
  • Go North, across the bridge
  • Find the Honey Tree on the other side of the bridge
🍯 Honey Tree 5

Route 205 → Fuego Ironworks

  • Use HM Surf on the water below the Honey Tree
  • Surf West and then North, following the path of the water
  • Continue until you reach land in Fuego Ironworks
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the water
🍯 Honey Tree 6

Fuego Ironworks → Route 205 → Eterna Forest

  • Go North through the grass
  • Go East, up the stairs and into Route 205
  • Go South and jump down twice
  • Go East and then North past the house and into the outside part of Eterna Forest (East of Eterna Forest entrance)
  • Use HM Cut and continue North
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the trees you used Cut on
🍯 Honey Tree 7

Eterna City → Route 205

  • Fly to Eterna City
  • Go West into Route 205
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the first patch of grass
🍯 Honey Tree 8

Oreburgh City → Route 207

  • Fly to Oreburgh City
  • Go North into Route 207
  • Go East of the grass and down the stairs
  • Ride your bike North, up the mudslide
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the mudslide
🍯 Honey Tree 9

Route 207 → Route 206

  • Go North from the last Honey Tree, into route 206
  • Go down one set of stairs
  • Go East and then North
  • Use HM Cut on the trees and continue North
  • Find the Honey Tree on the other side of the bridge
🍯 Honey Tree 10

Hearthome City → Route 208

  • Fly to Hearthome City
  • Go South until you reach the white fence
  • Go East until you reach the first path that goes South
  • Go South and then West into Route 208
  • Find the Honey Tree below the grass
🍯 Honey Tree 11

Route 208 → Hearthome City → Route 212

  • Go back East into Hearthome City
  • Go South into Route 212
  • Go South until you reach the first single tree
  • Go East into the little opening in the trees
  • Find the Honey Tree in the open area
🍯 Honey Tree 12

Route 212 → Hearthome City → Route 209

  • Go back North into Hearthome City
  • Go East into Route 209
  • Continue East, going across two bridges
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the last bridge
🍯 Honey Tree 13

Route 209 → Solaceon Town → Route 210

  • Go East of the tree back to the path
  • Go North, down the stairs, up the mudslide and into Solaceon Town
  • Go North through Solaceon Town into Route 210
  • Continue North, up the mudslide and down the stairs to the end of the tall grass
  • Find the Honey Tree East of the tall grass
🍯 Honey Tree 14

Route 210 → Route 215

  • Go North to the path
  • Go East into Route 215
  • Continue East, up the stairs
  • Go North, across the bridge
  • Go West, down the stairs
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the stairs
🍯 Honey Tree 15

Celestic Town → Route 211

  • Fly to Celestic Town     If you are battling, this is where I heal PP of moves
  • Go West past the NPC house
  • Go North to the path
  • Go West into Route 211
  • Find the Honey Tree in the grass
🍯 Honey Tree 16

Celestic Town → Route 210

  • Fly back to Celestic Town
  • Go North to the path
  • Go East into Route 210     If you are battling, this is where I use HM Defog
  • Continue East, down the stairs and across the bridge
  • Go South, up the stairs
  • Go North, across the bridge
  • Go East, across the bridge
  • Go South, down two sets of stairs
  • Go East, through the grass
  • Find the Honey Tree above the last patch of grass
🍯 Honey Tree 17

Pastoria City → Route 212

  • Fly to Pastoris City
  • Go South, past the Pokè-Mart
  • Go West, following the path into Route 212
  • Take the South path on Route 212
  • Continue West, through the grass and into the swamp
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the swamp water
🍯 Honey Tree 18

Pastoria City → Route 213

  • Fly back to Pastoria City
  • Go East into Route 213
  • Continue East, through the grass
  • Go South into the sand
  • Go West, behind the house and use HM Rock Smash
  • Find the Honey Tree on the West side of the rock
🍯 Honey Tree 19

Veilstone City → Route 214

  • Fly to Veilstone City
  • Go South into Route 214
  • Continue South until you get to the fence maze
  • Go South through the fence maze
  • Find the Honey Tree on the other side of the white fence after the fence maze
🍯 Honey Tree 20

Sunyshore City → Route 222

  • Fly to Sunyshore City
  • Go West into Route 222
  • Find the Honey Tree North of the gate exit
  • This is the last Honey Tree of the route!     Now you must wait 1 hour irl time before you start again

docs.title: Project PRNG
docs.text:
Project PRNG

A Shiny Legion experiment to test character-based RNG in PokeMMO. Upload your Archetype data, track your characters, and help uncover the truth.

📂 Upload Archetype Encounter File

Location: C:\Program Files\PokeMMO\data\mods\archetype-counter-main\src\stored\Profile Name

Make sure you start a new profile or clear encounters each time you make a new character, then choose that profile to upload here.

Select region Kanto Johto Hoenn Sinnoh Unova Mark as completed (Reached E4) Submit Character

Character data padded. Download the JSON code and share it with Kole or Kelly on Discord.

💾 Download JSON Directions
  • Upload the .txt file from the Archetype tool.
  • Fill in your player and character name.
  • Select the region your character started in.
  • If you reached the Elite Four, tick the "completed" checkbox to reveal the hours field.
  • Click Submit to convert your file into JSON automatically.
  • Download and share it with Kole via Discord.
  • You can update progress on a character by doing the same steps.
  • Repeat for each character, using a different name, to show multiple cards below.
Recommended Sweepers Recommended Supplies Play Guide
  • Create a new character in the region that feels easiest for you.
  • Use the button above to pick a powerful sweeper, or build your own team.
  • Mail yourself supplies like money, Poké Balls, and other essentials.
  • Play through the story until you reach the Elite Four.
  • Speed through and encounter as many wild Pokémon as possible along the way—even sweet scent if you can.
  • If you don’t find any shinies, mail supplies back, delete your character, and try again.
Filter + Sort All statuses Active Completed All regions Kanto Johto Hoenn Sinnoh Unova All Found shiny No shiny Clear Filters Close Feel free to offer edits/suggestions, these are just to get us started. Starmie

Type: Water / Psychic Base Stats: 115 Spe / 100 SpA / 85 SpD IVs: 25+ SpA/Spe Abilities: Natural Cure (ideal) Ideal Nature: Modest / Timid Moves: Surf / Psychic / Thunderbolt / Ice Beam Pros: Extremely fast, diverse coverage, handles most gyms solo. Cons: None. Strong In: All

Porygon-Z

Type: Normal Base Stats: 85 HP / 135 SpA / 90 Spe IVs: 25+ SpA/Spe Abilities: Adaptability Ideal Nature: Modest Moves: Tri Attack / Thunderbolt / Shadowball / Nasty Plot or Signal Beam Pros: Diverse coverage, fast evolution via items, only one weakness. Cons: Hard to obtain, no wild locations. Strong In: All

Gengar

Type: Ghost / Poison Base Stats: 110 SpA / 110 Spe IVs: 25+ SpA/Spe Abilities: Levitate Ideal Nature: Timid Moves: Shadow Ball / Thunderbolt / Giga Drain / Substitute|?? Pros: Fast, Sweeps Erika, Sabrina, Agatha. Huge movepool Cons: 4 weaknesses (Psychic/Ground/Ghost/Dark), has to trade evo. Strong In: Kanto / Hoenn

Gyarados

Type: Water / Flying Base Stats: 125 Atk / 100 Spe / 95 HP IVs: 25+ Atk/Spe Abilities: Intimidate Ideal Nature: Adamant Moves: Waterfall / Crunch / Dragon Dance / Ice Fang Pros: DD sweeper, smashes Koga, Blaine, Bruno. Cons: Strong In:

Alakazam

Type: Psychic Base Stats: 135 SpA / 120 Spe IVs: 25+ SpA/Spe Abilities: Synchronize Ideal Nature: Timid Moves: Psychic / Shadow Ball / Calm Mind / Recover Pros: Deletes anything that doesn't resist it. Cons: Strong In:

Close Recommended Supplies
  • Poké Balls
  • Potions
  • Repels
  • Antidotes
  • Revives

docs.title: Pheno Tracker
docs.text:
How Phenomenon Pokémon Work - [Open] Mechanics
  • Each Pokémon found via phenomena has a 30% chanceto have one IV at 30 or above.
  • There are always at least 2 phenomenaactive across Unova at any given time.
  • Phenomena last roughly 15–20 minutesbefore vanishing.
  • They do not appear in swarm reportsor through televisions like other special encounters.
Types of Phenomena IconTypeDescription Rustling Grass Found in grassy areas. Often contain rare wild Pokémon. Dust Cloud Common in caves, may contain Drilbur or items. Rippling Water Appears on fishing or surfing spots. Shadow Flying Pokémon shadows on bridges. Audio & Visual Cues
  • Sound intensityincreases as you get closer to the phenomenon.
  • Sounds never stopuntil the phenomenon expires—so follow your ears!
  • The visual effecthelps identify the type and location.
Show only missing Reset All 0 / 7 caught

docs.title: What are Phenomenon Pokémon?
docs.text:
Phenomenon Pokémon — or “Phenos” — are rare, special encounters that happen in shaking grass, swirling dust clouds, rippling water, or bridge shadows. They're often the hardest Pokémon to find in PokeMMO, and are usually the last ones players need to complete their regional or national dex.

This page helps you learn where to find each Pheno, what triggers their appearance, and allows you to track your progress by checking off the ones you’ve caught. Your progress is saved locally in your browser.

docs.title: Safari Tracker
docs.text:
How Johto Safari Rotations Work - [Open] Mechanics
  • The Johto Safari Zone has 6 zones which can be customised using Baoba’s tasks.
  • Each zone has rotating Pokémon that change daily at 00:00 UTC.
  • This page includes a rotation timer and full list of Pokémon per zone.
Rotation Timer Next rotation: calculating... Zone Layout ZoneCurrent ThemeKey Pokémon Show only missing Reset All 0 / ? caught

docs.title: What is the Johto Safari Zone?
docs.text: The Johto Safari Zone in PokeMMO rotates its Pokémon daily based on the current area theme. This tracker helps you view current spawns, track your catches, and understand the layout and schedule for Johto, Kanto, Hoenn, and Sinnoh Safari Zones.

docs.title: Other Safari Zones
docs.text: Kanto Safari Zone   - Classic bait/rock system. Pokémon flee often.     - Notable: Chansey, Scyther, Tauros, Dratini  Hoenn Safari Zone   - Split into north/south and wet/dry terrain.     - Notable: Heracross, Pikachu, Wobbuffet  Sinnoh Great Marsh   - Daily binocular-based spawn shifts in 6 areas.     - Notable: Carnivine, Croagunk, Skorupi
